text: Walter Bernstein (August 20, 1919 - January 23, 2021) was an American screenwriter and movie producer. He was blacklisted by the Hollywood movie studios in the 1950s. He was born in Brooklyn, New York City. His first major work was screenwriting Sidney Lumet's That Kind of Woman. He is known for his writing works Paris Blues (1961), Fail-Safe (1964), The Magnificent Seven (1960) and The Train (1964).Variety Magazine: "Screenwriter Walter Bernstein at 95: Still Front and Center" by Scott Foundas August 26, 2014 Bernstein died on January 23, 2021 in New York City from pneumonia, aged 101. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1919 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:American centenarians Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Movie producers from New York City Category:Screenwriters from New York City Category:Writers from Brooklyn
